summary: This document is an email forwarding a New York Times article about Barclays CEO James Staley stepping down following an inquiry related to Jeffrey Epstein. It appears to be internal correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: James Staley
persons.context: He is the subject of the forwarded New York Times article, stepping down from his position as CEO of Barclays following an inquiry related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His name is mentioned in the subject line of the forwarded article as the subject of an inquiry that led to James Staley's resignation.

connections.description: The document references an inquiry into Staley's relationship with Epstein, suggesting a professional or financial connection that was under investigation.

events.title: James Staley steps down as Barclays CEO
events.description: James Staley announces his resignation as CEO of Barclays bank following an inquiry into his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Barclays CEO James Staley stepped down in November 2021 following an inquiry related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The information about Staley's resignation was reported by The New York Times.
The document is an internal email within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating official interest in the matter.
